title: 110_s1368
content: The Act may be cited as the "Denali Commission Act Amendments Act of 2007" and outlines the authorities and duties of the Denali Commission. The Denali Commission Act Amendments Act of 2007 establishes the Denali Commission and outlines its powers, including the acceptance of matching funds for projects from public and private sources. Members of the Commission, except the Federal Cochairperson, are not considered Federal employees for any purpose. The Denali Commission Act Amendments Act of 2007 establishes the Denali Commission and allows for matching funds from public and private sources for approved projects. Amendments to the Commission Personnel Matters section include changes to member responsibilities and rates of pay. The Denali Commission Act Amendments Act of 2007 modifies member responsibilities and rates of pay within the Commission Personnel Matters section. It includes changes such as allowing federal employees to waive compensation and adjusting regulations for appointments. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to appoint necessary personnel and terminate them as needed for the Commission to perform its duties. In the Denali Commission Act of 1998, personnel can be appointed and terminated as needed for the Commission to carry out its duties. Additionally, in section 311, "shall" is replaced with "may" throughout. SEC. 3. SPECIAL FUNCTIONS OF THE DENALI COMMISSION. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to include a training program for careers in infrastructure development in rural Alaska. The Secretary of Labor can provide lump sum payments for this program, focusing on training for construction, operations, and maintenance of Commission projects. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to include a training program for careers in infrastructure development in rural Alaska, focusing on construction, operations, and maintenance of Commission projects. Additionally, initiatives for Alaskan youths to encourage careers supporting Commission projects are included. Amounts made available to the Commission under this subsection shall remain available until expended. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to include assistance for housing needs of teachers in rural Alaska, including activities like housing development, acquisition, rehabilitation, and new construction. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to authorize appropriations for fiscal years 2009 through 2014. The amendments made by sections 2 and 3 take effect upon enactment of the Act, while the amendment made by section 4 takes effect on October 1, 2008.
